The claim is supported by a statement fr: a group backed by the Koch brothers, which implies that Georgia's solar policies have resulted in rate hikes and have not made solar more economically viable.
The claim references a Louisiana study t: implying that similar policies in Georgia may have also been costly.
The claim compares Georgia: s net metering policies to those proposed in Florida, suggesting that if Georgia's policies have led to rate hikes and not made solar more economically viable, the same could happen in Florida.
Georgia Power: the state's largest utility, has stated that there has been no upward pressure on consumer rates as a result of their solar initiatives, contradicting the claim made by AFP Florida.
